Description: Glazed steatite scarab; pierced longitudinally; engraved elytra, head and legs and on the base the prenomen of Ramses II.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 255)
Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (No. 2254)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 81)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P41, Pl IV)
